00090 void CChannel::open(const sockaddr* addr)
00091 {
00092    // construct an socket
00093    m_iSocket = socket(m_iIPversion, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
00094 
00095    #ifdef WIN32
00096       if (INVALID_SOCKET == m_iSocket)
00097    #else
00098       if (m_iSocket < 0)
00099    #endif
00100       throw CUDTException(1, 0, NET_ERROR);
00101 
00102    if (NULL != addr)
00103    {
00104       socklen_t namelen = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00105 
00106       if (0 != bind(m_iSocket, addr, namelen))
00107          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00108    }
00109    else
00110    {
00111       //sendto or WSASendTo will also automatically bind the socket
00112       addrinfo hints;
00113       addrinfo* res;
00114 
00115       memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
00116 
00117       hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE;
00118       hints.ai_family = m_iIPversion;
00119       hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
00120 
00121       if (0 != getaddrinfo(NULL, "0", &hints, &res))
00122          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00123 
00124       if (0 != bind(m_iSocket, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen))
00125          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00126 
00127       freeaddrinfo(res);
00128    }
00129 
00130    setUDPSockOpt();
00131 }
00132 
00133 void CChannel::open(UDPSOCKET udpsock)
00134 {
00135    m_iSocket = udpsock;
00136    setUDPSockOpt();
00137 }
00138 
00139 void CChannel::setUDPSockOpt()
00140 {
00141    #if defined(BSD) || defined(OSX)
00142       // BSD system will fail setsockopt if the requested buffer size exceeds system maximum value
00143       int maxsize = 64000;
00144       if (0 != setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)&m_iRcvBufSize, sizeof(int)))
00145          setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)&maxsize, sizeof(int));
00146       if (0 != setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)&m_iSndBufSize, sizeof(int)))
00147          setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)&maxsize, sizeof(int));
00148    #else
00149       // for other systems, if requested is greated than maximum, the maximum value will be automactally used
00150       if ((0 != setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)&m_iRcvBufSize, sizeof(int))) ||
00151           (0 != setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)&m_iSndBufSize, sizeof(int))))
00152          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00153    #endif
00154 
00155    timeval tv;
00156    tv.tv_sec = 0;
00157    #if defined (BSD) || defined (OSX)
00158       // Known BSD bug as the day I wrote this code.
00159       // A small time out value will cause the socket to block forever.
00160       tv.tv_usec = 10000;
00161    #else
00162       tv.tv_usec = 100;
00163    #endif
00164 
00165    #ifdef UNIX
00166       // Set non-blocking I/O
00167       // UNIX does not support SO_RCVTIMEO
00168       int opts = fcntl(m_iSocket, F_GETFL);
00169       if (-1 == fcntl(m_iSocket, F_SETFL, opts | O_NONBLOCK))
00170          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00171    #elif WIN32
00172       DWORD ot = 1; //milliseconds
00173       if (0 != setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO, (char *)&ot, sizeof(DWORD)))
00174          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00175    #else
00176       // Set receiving time-out value
00177       if (0 != setsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO, (char *)&tv, sizeof(timeval)))
00178          throw CUDTException(1, 3, NET_ERROR);
00179    #endif
00180 }

00182 void CChannel::close() const
00183 {
00184    #ifndef WIN32
00185       ::close(m_iSocket);
00186    #else
00187       closesocket(m_iSocket);
00188    #endif
00189 }

00191 int CChannel::getSndBufSize()
00192 {
00193    socklen_t size = sizeof(socklen_t);
00194 
00195    getsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char *)&m_iSndBufSize, &size);
00196 
00197    return m_iSndBufSize;
00198 }
00199 
00200 int CChannel::getRcvBufSize()
00201 {
00202    socklen_t size = sizeof(socklen_t);
00203 
00204    getsockopt(m_iSocket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char *)&m_iRcvBufSize, &size);
00205 
00206    return m_iRcvBufSize;
00207 }

00219 void CChannel::getSockAddr(sockaddr* addr) const
00220 {
00221    socklen_t namelen = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00222 
00223    getsockname(m_iSocket, addr, &namelen);
00224 }

00226 void CChannel::getPeerAddr(sockaddr* addr) const
00227 {
00228    socklen_t namelen = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00229 
00230    getpeername(m_iSocket, addr, &namelen);
00231 }

00233 int CChannel::sendto(const sockaddr* addr, CPacket& packet) const
00234 {
00235    // convert control information into network order
00236    if (packet.getFlag())
00237       for (int i = 0, n = packet.getLength() / 4; i < n; ++ i)
00238          *((uint32_t *)packet.m_pcData + i) = htonl(*((uint32_t *)packet.m_pcData + i));
00239 
00240    // convert packet header into network order
00241    //for (int j = 0; j < 4; ++ j)
00242    //   packet.m_nHeader[j] = htonl(packet.m_nHeader[j]);
00243    uint32_t* p = packet.m_nHeader;
00244    for (int j = 0; j < 4; ++ j)
00245    {
00246       *p = htonl(*p);
00247       ++ p;
00248    }
00249 
00250    #ifndef WIN32
00251       msghdr mh;
00252       mh.msg_name = (sockaddr*)addr;
00253       mh.msg_namelen = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00254       mh.msg_iov = (iovec*)packet.m_PacketVector;
00255       mh.msg_iovlen = 2;
00256       mh.msg_control = NULL;
00257       mh.msg_controllen = 0;
00258       mh.msg_flags = 0;
00259 
00260       int res = sendmsg(m_iSocket, &mh, 0);
00261    #else
00262       DWORD size = CPacket::m_iPktHdrSize + packet.getLength();
00263       int addrsize = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00264       int res = WSASendTo(m_iSocket, (LPWSABUF)packet.m_PacketVector, 2, &size, 0, addr, addrsize, NULL, NULL);
00265       res = (0 == res) ? size : -1;
00266    #endif
00267 
00268    // convert back into local host order
00269    //for (int k = 0; k < 4; ++ k)
00270    //   packet.m_nHeader[k] = ntohl(packet.m_nHeader[k]);
00271    p = packet.m_nHeader;
00272    for (int k = 0; k < 4; ++ k)
00273    {
00274       *p = ntohl(*p);
00275        ++ p;
00276    }
00277 
00278    if (packet.getFlag())
00279       for (int l = 0, n = packet.getLength() / 4; l < n; ++ l)
00280          *((uint32_t *)packet.m_pcData + l) = ntohl(*((uint32_t *)packet.m_pcData + l));
00281 
00282    return res;
00283 }
00284 
00285 int CChannel::recvfrom(sockaddr* addr, CPacket& packet) const
00286 {
00287    #ifndef WIN32
00288       msghdr mh;   
00289       mh.msg_name = addr;
00290       mh.msg_namelen = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00291       mh.msg_iov = packet.m_PacketVector;
00292       mh.msg_iovlen = 2;
00293       mh.msg_control = NULL;
00294       mh.msg_controllen = 0;
00295       mh.msg_flags = 0;
00296 
00297       #ifdef UNIX
00298          fd_set set;
00299          timeval tv;
00300          FD_ZERO(&set);
00301          FD_SET(m_iSocket, &set);
00302          tv.tv_sec = 0;
00303          tv.tv_usec = 10000;
00304          select(m_iSocket+1, &set, NULL, &set, &tv);
00305       #endif
00306 
00307       int res = recvmsg(m_iSocket, &mh, 0);
00308    #else
00309       DWORD size = CPacket::m_iPktHdrSize + packet.getLength();
00310       DWORD flag = 0;
00311       int addrsize = (AF_INET == m_iIPversion) ? sizeof(sockaddr_in) : sizeof(sockaddr_in6);
00312 
00313       int res = WSARecvFrom(m_iSocket, (LPWSABUF)packet.m_PacketVector, 2, &size, &flag, addr, &addrsize, NULL, NULL);
00314       res = (0 == res) ? size : -1;
00315    #endif
00316 
00317    if (res <= 0)
00318    {
00319       packet.setLength(-1);
00320       return -1;
00321    }
00322 
00323    packet.setLength(res - CPacket::m_iPktHdrSize);
00324 
00325    // convert back into local host order
00326    //for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++ i)
00327    //   packet.m_nHeader[i] = ntohl(packet.m_nHeader[i]);
00328    uint32_t* p = packet.m_nHeader;
00329    for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++ i)
00330    {
00331       *p = ntohl(*p);
00332       ++ p;
00333    }
00334 
00335    if (packet.getFlag())
00336       for (int j = 0, n = packet.getLength() / 4; j < n; ++ j)
00337          *((uint32_t *)packet.m_pcData + j) = ntohl(*((uint32_t *)packet.m_pcData + j));
00338 
00339    return packet.getLength();
00340 }
